Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class GeoTessPosition

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.geotess.GeoTessPosition
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeoTessPositionLinear, GeoTessPositionNatualNeighbor
public abstract class GeoTessPosition
extends java.lang.Object
Manages information about a single point at an arbitrary position in a GeoTessModel. It supports interpolation of Data at the position it represents, using either linear or higher order interpolation. When interpolating data, the data in a number of surrounding Profiles are first interpolated in the radial dimension at each of the vertices. Then those values are interpolated in the geographic dimensions. Both linear and higher order interpolation schemes are supported. With linear interpolation the vertices of the triangle containing the position and the 3 interpolation coefficients calculated during the triangle walking algorithm are used to interpolate data. For higher order interpolation, cubic splines are used to interpolate data along radial profies and then the Natural Neighbor interpolation algorithm (Sibson, 1980, 19821) is implemented to interpolate data in the geographic dimensions.

GeoTessPosition is not thread-safe in that it's internal state is mutable. The design intention is that single instances of a GeoTessGrid object and GeoTessData object can be shared among all the threads in a multi-threaded application and each thread will have it's own instance of a GeoTessPosition object that references the common GeoTessGrid + GeoTessData combination.

Sibson, R., (1980) A Vector Identity for the Dirichlet Tessellation, Proc. Cambridge Philosophical Society, 87, 151-155.

Sibson, R. (1981). "A brief description of natural neighbor interpolation (Chapter 2)". In V. Barnett. Interpreting Multivariate Data. Chichester: John Wiley. pp. 21-36.

Author:
Sandy Ballard

      public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessModel model) throws GeoTessException
      Static factory method that returns a GeoTessPosition object that uses linear interpolatorin in both the horizontal and radial dimensions.
      Parameters:
      model -
      Returns:
      a GeoTessPosition object.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getGeoTessPosition

      public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessModel model, gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType) throws GeoTessException
      Static factory method that returns the desired type of GeoTessPosition object. If the horizontal InterpolationType is LINEAR, then the radial interpolation type will be linear as well. If the horizontal InterpolationType is NATURAL_NEIGHBOR, then the radial interpolation type will be CUBIC_SPLINE.
      Parameters:
      model - the GeoTessModel from which values will be extracted
      horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
      Returns:
      a GeoTessPosition object.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getGeoTessPosition

      public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessModel model, gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType, gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType) throws GeoTessException
      Static factory method that returns the desired type of GeoTessPosition object.
      Parameters:
      model - the GeoTessModel from which values will be extracted
      horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
      radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
      Returns:
      a GeoTessPosition object.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getGeoTessPosition

      public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp) throws GeoTessException
      Static factory method that returns a new GeoTessPosition of the same horizontal and radial interpolation types using the same GeoTessModel. Note that the position of the new interpolator is not set and must be set by the caller.
      Parameters:
      gtp - The GeoTessPosition object for which a new one is created of the same interpolation types and using the same GeoTessModel.
      Returns:
      A new GeoTessPosition of the same horizontal and radial interpolation types using the same GeoTessModel.

      GeoTessException

    • getGradient

      public void getGradient​(int attribute, boolean reciprocal, double[] gradient) throws GeoTessException
      Retrieve an interpolated gradient for the specified model attribute. If the gradient has not been pre-computed for any profiles contributing to the interpolation result, then they are evaluated here using the reciprocal flag setting. If they were pre-computed then the reciprocal flag is ignored.
      Parameters:
      attribute - The attribute index for which the gradient is interpolated.
      reciprocal - The reciprocal flag used to evaluate any undefined gradients for profiles used in the interpolation.
      gradient - The interpolated gradient is written here.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getGradient

      public void getGradient​(int attribute, int majorLayerIndex, boolean reciprocal, double[] gradient) throws GeoTessException
      Retrieve an interpolated gradient for the specified model attribute. If the gradient has not been pre-computed for any profiles contributing to the interpolation result, then they are evaluated here using the reciprocal flag setting. If they were pre-computed then the reciprocal flag is ignored.
      Parameters:
      attribute - The attribute index for which the gradient is interpolated.
      majorLayerIndex - The layer id for which the gradient is set.
      reciprocal - The reciprocal flag used to evaluate any undefined gradients for profiles used in the interpolation.
      gradient - The interpolated gradient is written here.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getDerivHorizontal

      public double[] getDerivHorizontal​(double[] receiver) throws java.lang.Exception
      Retrieve the derivatives of the attributes wrt to horizontal position. Assume that this GeoTessPosition object is currently set to the location of a seismic source. The location of the receiver is passed in as a parameter. This method will return the derivatives of the attributes wrt to source-receiver separation. Returns NaN if anything goes wrong.
      Returns:
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • getWeights

      public void getWeights​(double dkm, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Double> weights) throws GeoTessException
      Returns the influencing node weights at the current position.
      Parameters:
      dkm - The step size about the position (km).
      weights - The weight list that associates the active point index with its determined weight. Note this map is not cleared. Calculated weights are added to any previously existing values.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getWeights

      public void getWeights​(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Double> weights, double dkm, double radius, int majorLayerIndex, gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialInterpType) throws GeoTessException
      Returns the influencing node weights at the current lateral position using the input layer index and radius.
      Parameters:
      dkm - The step size about the position (km).
      weights - The weight list that associates the active point index with its determined weight. Note this map is not cleared. Calculated weights are added to any previously existing values.
      radius - The radius at which the interpolation is performed.
      majorLayerIndex - The major layer index for which the interpolation is performed.
      radialInterpType - The radial interpolation type.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

      Creates an outward pointing normal vector at the top of the input layer index for the current lateral position of this GeoTessPosition and returns the result in the input normal vector.
      Parameters:
      layr - The index of the layer for which the normal will be returned.
      normal - The outward pointing normal vector at the top of the input layer for the current lateral position of this GeoTessPosition.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • setModel

      public boolean setModel​(GeoTessModel newModel) throws GeoTessException
      Replace the model that currently supports this GeoTessPosition object with a new model. For this to work, the new model and the current model must use the same grid.

      The benefit of calling this method is that if the application needs to interpolate a value at the same geographic position in multiple models that share the same grid, then the walking triangle algorithm and the calculation of geographic interpolation coefficients do not have to be repeated.

      Parameters:
      newModel - model that is to replace the currently supported model.
      Returns:
      reference to this GeoTessPosition object.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException - if the new model and current model do not have GeoTessGrids that have the same gridID.

    • set

      public GeoTessPosition set​(double lat, double lon, double depth) throws GeoTessException
      Set the interpolation point to specified latitude and and longitude in degrees and depth in km below the surface of the ellipsoid.
      Parameters:
      lat - in degrees.
      lon - in degrees.
      depth - below the surface of the ellipsoid in km.
      Returns:
      reference to this GeoTessPosition object.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • set

      public GeoTessPosition set​(double[] uVector, double newRadius) throws GeoTessException
      Set the interpolation point. This method will perform a walking triangle search for the triangle in which the specified position is located and compute the associated 2D and radial interpolation coefficients.
      Parameters:
      uVector - the Earth-centered unit vector that defines the position that is to be set.
      newRadius - the radius of the position, in km.
      Returns:
      reference to this GeoTessPosition object.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getInterfaceIndex

      public int getInterfaceIndex​(double radius) throws GeoTessException
      Retrieve the index of the major layer in which radius resides. If radius < radius of first layer, returns 0. If radius >= the surface of the model, returns the index of the outermost layer that has finite thickness.
      Parameters:
      radius -
      Returns:
      int
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getInterfacesPerLayer

      public int[] getInterfacesPerLayer​(double radius0, double maxSpacing) throws GeoTessException
      Returns an int[] of length = to number of major layers. Each element is the number of evenly spaced nodes required in that layer in order for the node spacing to be <= maxSpacing (in km). The first element is at the smallest radius (near center of earth) and the last element is near the surface. Within a layer, there will be a node at both the top and bottom of the layer. This means that there will be two nodes for each major layer interface.

      Layers below the layer containing radius0 will have value 0. Layer that contains radius0 will take into account that nodes will start at radius0.

      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getRadiusTop

      public double getRadiusTop​(int layer) throws GeoTessException

    • setMaxTessLevel

      public void setMaxTessLevel​(int layerId, int maxTessLevel) throws GeoTessException
      Set the maximum tessellation level such that the triangle that is found during a walking triangle search will be on a tessellation level that is no higher than the specified value. Default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE-1.
      Parameters:
      layerId -
      maxTessLevel -
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getMaxTessLevel

      Parameters:
      layerId -
      Returns:
      current value of maxTessLevel

    • getLayerDiscretization

      public int[] getLayerDiscretization​(double maxSpacing) throws GeoTessException
      Returns an int[] of length = to number of major layers. Each element is the number of evenly spaced nodes required in that layer in order for the node spacing to be <= maxSpacing (in km). The first element is at the smallest radius (near center of earth) and the last element is near the surface. Within a layer, there will be a node at both the top and bottom of the layer.     • getRadiusConstrained

      public double getRadiusConstrained() throws GeoTessException
      Retrieve the radius of the current position, in km. If radius is constrained to a specific layer, and the radius specified in most recent call to a set() method was outside the range of the specified layer, then the radius of the top or bottom of the layer is returned.
      Returns:
      the radius of the current position, in km.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • setRadiusConstrained

      public double setRadiusConstrained​(int layer) throws GeoTessException
      Resets the radius of the current position, in km, if out of range of the input layer. If radius is constrained to a specific layer, and the radius specified in most recent call to a set() method was outside the range of the specified layer, then the radius of the top or bottom of the layer is set as the current radius. The new position (or old, if not set) is returned on exit.
      Parameters:
      layer - The input layer into which the radius is contrained.
      Returns:
      the radius of the current position, in km.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getDepthConstrained

      public double getDepthConstrained() throws GeoTessException

      the depth of the current position in km.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getErrorValue

      public double getErrorValue()

      Returns:
      current value of the errorValue.

      Parameters:
      errorValue -

    • getVertexIndex

      public int getVertexIndex()
      If the position of this GeoTessPosition obect is currently set to a location that coincides with one of the grid vertices, return the index of that vertex. Otherwise return -1. Colocation includes a small tolerance, i.e., the interpolation coefficient > 0.999999999.
      Returns:
      index of colocated vertex or -1.

    • getGeoTessPosition

      public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp0, GeoTessPosition gtp1, double f) throws GeoTessException
      Creates and returns a new GeoTessPosition object whose coordinates are set to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1. The new GeoTessPosition uses the same GeoTessModel and interpolator types as the input arguments.
      Parameters:
      gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
      gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
      f - A fraction defining on 3D point on a line that passes through gtp0 and gtp1. The new point is measured from gtp0.
      Returns:
      A new GeoTessPosition object whose coordinates are set to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • setIntermediatePosition

      public void setIntermediatePosition​(double[] threeDVector, double f) throws GeoTessException
      Sets this GeoTessPosition to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1.
      Parameters:
      threeDVector - A 3D vector acting as the second point from this positions location.
      f - A fraction defining a 3D point on a line that passes through this node and the input 3D vector. The new position is measured from this position.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • setIntermediatePosition

      public void setIntermediatePosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp0, GeoTessPosition gtp1, double f) throws GeoTessException
      Sets this GeoTessPosition to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1.
      Parameters:
      gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
      gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
      f - A fraction defining on 3D point on a line that passes through gtp0 and gtp1. The new position is measured from gtp0.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getGeoTessUnitVectorPosition

      public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessUnitVectorPosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp0, GeoTessPosition gtp1, double f) throws GeoTessException
      Creates and returns a new GeoTessPosition object whose coordinates are set to the fractional unit vector position f between the positions gtp0 and gtp1 (f=0 ==> unit vector = gtp0 unit vector). The radii are set in a similar fashion and the new position is set into this GeoTessPosition.
      Parameters:
      gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
      gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
      f - A fraction defining the amount of direction and radius to apply from gtp0 to gtp1.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • setIntermediateUnitVectorPosition

      public void setIntermediateUnitVectorPosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp0, GeoTessPosition gtp1, double f) throws GeoTessException
      Sets this GeoTessPosition to the fractional unit vector position f between the positions gtp0 and gtp1 (f=0 ==> unit vector = gtp0 unit vector). The radii are set in a similar fashion and the new position is set into this GeoTessPosition.
      Parameters:
      gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
      gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
      f - A fraction defining the amount of direction and radius to apply from gtp0 to gtp1.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • setIntermediatePosition

      public void setIntermediatePosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp0, GeoTessPosition gtp1, double f, int layerId) throws GeoTessException
      Sets this GeoTessPosition to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1, and then moves the radius to the top of the layer given by layerId.
      Parameters:
      gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
      gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
      f - A fraction defining on 3D point on a line that passes through gtp0 and gtp1. The new position is measured from gtp0. layerId The layer that the radius of this GeoTessPosition will be set.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • move

      public void move​(GeoTessPosition gtp, double[] vtp, double x, double y, int layerId) throws GeoTessException
      Move this gtp's unit vector in the direction of vtp by distance y. Then rotate the result around vtp by angle x. Set the position of this GeoTessPosition to the new position. Then set the radius to the radius of the specified layerId.
      Parameters:
      gtp -
      vtp -
      x -
      y -
      layerId -
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • move_north

      public boolean move_north​(double d, double[] vtp)
      Compute a unit vector that is distance d radians due north of this GeoVector and return it in vtp. The current position is not modified.
      Parameters:
      d - The distance North to move (radians).
      vtp - The new position
      Returns:
      true if operation successful, false if this is already at north or south pole.

    • setIndex

      public void setIndex​(int i)
      Sets this GeoTessPosition index to i.
      Parameters:
      i - New index value.

    • getIndex

      public int getIndex()
      Returns this GeoTessPosition index setting.
      Returns:
      The GeoTessPosition index setting.
